posts.post_content: Planning on making a white metalcraft deck with him. [Ardent Recruit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ardent Recruit), [Auriok Edgewright](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Auriok Edgewright), [Auriok Sunchaser](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Auriok Sunchaser), and to top it all off [Etched Champion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Etched Champion). Posted By: Revelation666 (4/28/2011 10:40:59 PM)

posts.post_content:
I like this card, it's good for equipment decks, especially for living weapon decks. All your bonehoards now cost 0 to equip when the creature dies. On the other hand, tournament decks are not playing so much equipment you want, or need, this guy. Neither are most casual decks. There is some decent equipment running around out there, but for table top players most people don't own 4 copies of every one of the enemy color swords like the sword of war and peace.
  
   
I think where it shines best is in a kor equipment deck with living weapons such as bone hoard, and now even batterskull (if you can get one since it will likely be cost 30+ by the end of the week and the set is not even out yet).
posts.html:
I like this card, it's good for equipment decks, especially for living weapon decks. All your bonehoards now cost 0 to equip when the creature dies. On the other hand, tournament decks are not playing so much equipment you want, or need, this guy. Neither are most casual decks. There is some decent equipment running around out there, but for table top players most people don't own 4 copies of every one of the enemy color swords like the sword of war and peace.

I think where it shines best is in a kor equipment deck with living weapons such as bone hoard, and now even batterskull (if you can get one since it will likely be cost 30+ by the end of the week and the set is not even out yet).

posts.post_content:
Interesting;y enough, there are actually rules that state that a creature cannot equip itself to itself, just in case some degenerate game breaking combo existed that allowed something to do that, a la bludgeon brawl liquidmetal coating or march of the mahcines. it makes me sad :( I can't actually quote the rule though.   
  
The card can be just absolutely incredible though. having him drop, equipping him with a whole shit ton of swords and like the new swiftfoot boots or any other haste giver and your in business. I remember one person attempted to pull this on me and just wreck my board position but mana leak came to the rescue. A pretty solid card in the right deck if your capable enough to make it work without dosruption.
posts.html:

The card can be just absolutely incredible though. having him drop, equipping him with a whole shit ton of swords and like the new swiftfoot boots or any other haste giver and your in business. posts.post_content:
Bah, I dislike this guy. Magic is just giving away over-the-top abilies, and pushing OP knights. Worst thing is, they're usually even good enough to see real play, or so I've noticed.
  
I mean, back in the day, this guy would say "equip costs 2 less", and he'd be great. But just out-and-out making all equip costs 0? And nobody's mentioned Leonin Shikari?
  
I guess it's probably the only way Equipment could hope to keep up in it's losing battle to Enchantress, after Umbra Mystic made it just that much scarier.
  
   
And for real people memnites and darksteel relics? Use Accorder Shields, with him it's a no-brainer.
posts.html:
Bah, I dislike this guy. Magic is just giving away over-the-top abilies, and pushing OP knights. Worst thing is, they're usually even good enough to see real play, or so I've noticed.
I mean, back in the day, this guy would say "equip costs 2 less", and he'd be great. But just out-and-out making all equip costs 0? And nobody's mentioned Leonin Shikari?
I guess it's probably the only way Equipment could hope to keep up in it's losing battle to Enchantress, after Umbra Mystic made it just that much scarier.

And for real people memnites and darksteel relics? Use Accorder Shields, with him it's a no-brainer.
